text: heya ohooo lovely
Thanks :sweat_smile:
hopefully it helps solidify the fish and mine character in your head
Yeah definitely, it's also helped me with the art style
the colour script isnt quite what I expected tho.
is this a representation of the colours you expect to use
Yeah sorry I threw that together quickly yesterday :joy:
It was just colour picks from that I liked at the time. There's no real order to it.
no worries, I think its still a useful thing to keep working on. it can just be a bunch of screenshots of films depicting moods you feel connect with your film ( finding nemo for example )
Ah fair enough :+1:
its definitely useful what you have there, id call it more "Colour Consideration"
as calling it a colour script would imply some kind of narrative
oh i see what you were doing
True, I'll rename it :+1:

like at the top of this image there are the colour bars, they are relevant sequentially as they capture the dominant colour(s) of that time in the films duration. Through that you can often get information on the overall tone/ arc or recurring motifs
Ok :blush:
hows your work going?
My job?
yea, anything exciting going on with it? any interesting projects you are on?
Yeah, nothing crazy. I got paid today which was cool. And one of the labels I designed got printed 10,000 times which was pretty cool :sweat_smile:
wheyhey
I kind of feel wasted at the job though, but it's easy money I guess :sweat_smile:
there will be lots of soft skills you will be learning
from interacting with people and watching people interact
all work experience is valuable even if it may not seem so at the time
That's true, and I get the feeling that I could get a job there after I graduate which would be nice.
I have a great sense of dread that when I graduate I'm going to really struggle to get a job in my field :sweat_smile:
It can be tough, it helps if you are prepared to move and take on jobs that might not seem super relevant immediately but could have oportunity to move up ( like being a runner in a bigger studio )
you have a year to figure this out tho
Oh absolutely, I know I'll be going in at the bottom, but that's almost reassuring. There's less pressure on you at the start I guess.
yea theres always lots to learn
were you able to get a blog running?
I have a Wix website that I used for my last year of Uni (I had to blog for that as well)
I'll probably use that although I don't want anyone stumbling across it.
are you not able to make private pages for Wix?
I'm not sure, probably :blush:
Or at least password protected
It would be very useful to see your progress recorded in one place
it does not have to be public
you can make un-listed bloger pages too
Yeah
makes it easier to get feedback from people and stops you from 'fiddling' with things as it makes them more finished
Yeah :blush:
I'm really looking forward to getting this project underway :blush:
if i give you a homework task of next week having some kind of blog/private wix page running. do you think that would be possible?
Yeah absolutely
nice one, it should help with project satisfaction too ( it definitely did for me )
cool, lets go for that then
is there anything else you would like to chat about today?
<https://waveletsjoshua.wixsite.com/joshuaboyd/home>
That's the website in its current form, it's nothing fancy its just something I threw together because it was one of my requirements that my work was on a blog
is it easy to make a seperate page for sea of mine speciffically?
Yeah quite easy :blush:
perfect
How has your week been? :blush:
quite busy. lots of little emergencies that need little tools made for them
That sounds stressful :sweat_smile:
things like - replace this characters head in 10 episodes
Ah ok :blush:
it can be, but the team is very understanding and experienced so we all trust eachother and dont put too much pressure if we thing deadlines might be unrealistic
Well that sounds good :+1:
im getting quite nerdily excited about pipeline planning :stuck_out_tongue:
Haha ah yes the pipeline :joy:
I used to reverse engineer everything, like draw my storyboards after my film in case I had to change things last minute :sweat_smile:
But now I see the value in a good structured process
reverse engineering is useful for understangding the process
but yea, process is very important
especially if you want to bea able to to hit deadlines ( so everyone has a job)
Yeah :grin:
That's what I liked about working with people. (not group projects they're a nightmare) when it's going smoothly it's amazing how fast things come together :grin:
yea, thats the rewarding part of my job, helping people that are very good at their job be able to just focus on their job ( and not the things surrounding it)
like admin and make deadlines easy to manage
Yeah, behind every good team is a good manager :blush:
do you have an idea of the internships that will be available after you graduate next year?
A pretty good idea :blush:
Those Blue zoo one look great haha :wink:
if there is a speciffic one in mind ( one that is character design speciffically for example ) it would be good to make sure your portfolio is tailored for it
That's a good question.
haha, yea they are :stuck_out_tongue:
I'm not entirely sure. I love rigging characters in After Effects but I know everyone uses Harmony now and I know I'd have to learn that for a rigging job.
I can paint and draw pretty good, but I don't think it's good enough for character design or background design :joy:
I like puppet animation over frame by frame as well.
for the internship positions i know of they are for specific job roles only ( no generalist )
could you list the speciffic roles you ( at this stage) would be interested in?
I know :persevere:

2D Animator
Character Designer
Production Assistant 
Runner 
Motion Graphics Artist
I do some freelance work on Upwork as a 2D motion graphics artist (think explainer videos) because it's easy money.
cool cool. I dont know too much about motion graphics industry so dont have much to say about that
but for runner and production assistant the important thing is personality fit with the team - so will depend a lot on the company you apply at
Yeah, its kind of my fallback option, but freelancing is very lonely :persevere:
production assistants are often required to know production tracking software: fTrack, shotgun
or excell/ google spreadsheets
Oh I've never heard of fTrack or shotgun
yea i struggle with freelancing from home too.
I use Excel a lot though.
It's great for groups of people to keep track of what shots have been done or need doing
its almsost impossible to learn ftrack or shotgun in a non-production environment, but it would be handy to google them so that you know the basics of what they are and how the cay be used
Fair enough :+1:
Hey I keep forgetting to say, thanks so much for taking the time to mentor me, especially when you're getting nothing out of it :blush:
Character Designer is incredibly competetive and a lot of luck is involved ( having the right style in your showreel for the show )
I really appreciate the help.
no worries, Im very happy to help :slightly_smiling_face:
Yeah everyone I know wants to be a character animator... And a lot of them can't draw very well :thinking_face:
if that is your goal id recommend keeping a sketchbook and trying to post your work regularly so you can get feedback
character designers need to be good at taking criticism and knowing when it is relevant/helpful
as EVERYONE has an opinion on character design so they need to be able to handle unhelpful comments politely
Yeah, to be honest I loved working with an Illustrator and bringing their amazing designs to life :sweat_smile:
yea character designers need to draw well
a good path to character design is prop design, but you need to make sure that you have a convincing prop design portfolio also
its a good way to test your ability to create appeal for even mundane objects
Ah yeah.
That's a good idea.
and for character animation, drawing is also useful, but more life drawing so that you understand posing, line of action and framing
you dont need to be able to draw super well, but its important to be able to communicate a gesture
Oh I really enjoy life drawing and still life drawing. :blush:
It's really therapeutic and I miss doing it since I'm home from uni :blush:
excellent :slightly_smiling_face:
sorry josh, got to go now
No worries :+1:
homework: sea of mine blog for next week :slightly_smiling_face:
Got it :grin:
